verses.roman:
vṛndāvana haite tumi gauḍa-deśa diyā
āmāre milibā nīlācalete āsiyā

synonyms: vṛndāvana haite—from Vṛndāvana; tumi—you; gauḍa-deśa diyā—by way of Bengal; āmāre—Me; milibā—will meet; nīlācalete—at Jagannātha Purī; āsiyā—coming.
translation: "Later, you can go from Vṛndāvana to Jagannātha Purī through Bengal [Gauḍa-deśa]. There you will meet Me again."
